Detailed Description

template<typename T>
class thrust::system::cpp::pointer< T >

pointer stores a pointer to an object allocated in memory available to the cpp system. This type provides type safety when dispatching standard algorithms on ranges resident in cpp memory.

pointer has pointer semantics: it may be dereferenced and manipulated with pointer arithmetic.

pointer can be created with the function cpp::malloc, or by explicitly calling its constructor with a raw pointer.

The raw pointer encapsulated by a pointer may be obtained by eiter its get member function or the raw_pointer_cast function.

Note:
pointer is not a "smart" pointer; it is the programmer's responsibility to deallocate memory pointed to by pointer.
Template Parameters:
Tspecifies the type of the pointee.
See also:
cpp::malloc
cpp::free
raw_pointer_cast

pointer's no-argument constructor initializes its encapsulated pointer to 0.
